49/** \defgroup svector Sparse and compressed vectors
50 Sparse vector for integer types using bit transposition transform
51
52 @ingroup bmagic

56/** \defgroup sv bit-sliced (bitwise transposition) succinct sparse vectors
57 Sparse vector for integer types using bit transposition transform
58
59 @ingroup bmagic
60 */
61
62
63/*!
64 \brief succinct sparse vector with runtime compression using bit-slicing / transposition method
65
66 Sparse vector implements variable bit-depth storage model.
67 Initial data is bit-sliced into bit-vectors (all bits 0 become bv[0] so each element
68 may use less memory than the original native data type.
69 For example, 32-bit integer may only use 20 bits.
70
71 Container supports both signed and unsigned integer types.
72
73 Another level of compression is provided by bit-vector (BV template parameter)
74 used for storing bit planes. bvector<> implements varians of on the fly block
75 compression, so if a significant area of a sparse vector uses less bits - it
76 will save memory.
77 bm::bvector<> is a sparse data strucrture, so is bm::sparse_vector<>. It should be noted
78 that as succinct data it works for both sparse or dense vectors.
79
80 Container also supports notion of NULL (unassigned value) which can be treated
81 differently than 0.
82
83 @ingroup sv
84*/
85template<class Val, class BV>
86class sparse_vector : public base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, 1>
87{
88public:
89 typedef Val value_type;
90 typedef BV bvector_type;
91 typedef bvector_type* bvector_type_ptr;
92 typedef typename bvector_type::size_type size_type;
93 typedef typename bvector_type::block_idx_type block_idx_type;
94 typedef const bvector_type* bvector_type_const_ptr;
95 typedef const value_type& const_reference;
96 typedef typename BV::allocator_type allocator_type;
97 typedef typename bvector_type::allocation_policy allocation_policy_type;
98 typedef typename bvector_type::enumerator bvector_enumerator_type;
99 typedef typename allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
100 typedef bm::basic_bmatrix<BV> bmatrix_type;
101 typedef base_sparse_vector<Val, BV, 1> parent_type;
102 typedef typename parent_type::unsigned_value_type unsigned_value_type;
103
104
105 /*! Statistical information about memory allocation details. */
106 struct statistics : public bv_statistics
107 {};
108
109 /*! Traits and features used in algorithms to correctly run
110 on a particular type of sparse vector
111 */
112 struct is_remap_support { enum trait { value = false }; };
113 struct is_rsc_support { enum trait { value = false }; };
114 struct is_dynamic_splices { enum trait { value = false }; };
115
116 /**
117 Reference class to access elements via common [] operator
118 @ingroup sv
119 */
120 class reference
121 {
122 public:
123 reference(sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv, size_type idx) BMNOEXCEPT
124 : sv_(sv), idx_(idx)
125 {}
126 operator value_type() const BMNOEXCEPT { return sv_.get(idx_); }
127 reference& operator=(const reference& ref)
128 {
129 sv_.set(idx_, (value_type)ref);
130 return *this;
131 }
132 reference& operator=(value_type val)
133 {
134 sv_.set(idx_, val);
135 return *this;
136 }
137 bool operator==(const reference& ref) const BMNOEXCEPT
138 { return bool(*this) == bool(ref); }
139 bool is_null() const BMNOEXCEPT { return sv_.is_null(idx_); }
140 private:
141 sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv_;
142 size_type idx_;
143 };
144
145
146 /**
147 Const iterator to traverse the sparse vector.
148
149 Implementation uses buffer for decoding so, competing changes
150 to the original vector may not match the iterator returned values.
151
152 This iterator keeps an operational buffer for 8K elements,
153 so memory footprint is not negligable (about 64K for unsigned int)
154
155 @ingroup sv
156 */
157 class const_iterator
158 {
159 public:
160 friend class sparse_vector;
161
162#ifndef BM_NO_STL
163 typedef std::input_iterator_tag iterator_category;
164#endif
165 typedef sparse_vector<Val, BV> sparse_vector_type;
166 typedef sparse_vector_type* sparse_vector_type_ptr;
167 typedef typename sparse_vector_type::value_type value_type;
168 typedef typename sparse_vector_type::size_type size_type;
169 typedef typename sparse_vector_type::bvector_type bvector_type;
170 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type allocator_type;
171 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
172 typedef bm::byte_buffer<allocator_type> buffer_type;
173
174 typedef unsigned difference_type;
175 typedef unsigned* pointer;
176 typedef value_type& reference;
177
178 public:
179 const_iterator() BMNOEXCEPT;
180 const_iterator(const sparse_vector_type* sv) BMNOEXCEPT;
181 const_iterator(const sparse_vector_type* sv, size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT;
182 const_iterator(const const_iterator& it) BMNOEXCEPT;
183
184
185 bool operator==(const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
186 { return (pos_ == it.pos_) && (sv_ == it.sv_); }
187 bool operator!=(const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
188 { return ! operator==(it); }
189 bool operator < (const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
190 { return pos_ < it.pos_; }
191 bool operator <= (const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
192 { return pos_ <= it.pos_; }
193 bool operator > (const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
194 { return pos_ > it.pos_; }
195 bool operator >= (const const_iterator& it) const BMNOEXCEPT
196 { return pos_ >= it.pos_; }
197
198 /// \brief Get current position (value)
199 value_type operator*() const { return this->value(); }
200
201
202 /// \brief Advance to the next available value
203 const_iterator& operator++() BMNOEXCEPT { this->advance(); return *this; }
204
205 /// \brief Advance to the next available value
206 ///
207 const_iterator operator++(int)
208 { const_iterator tmp(*this);this->advance(); return tmp; }
209
210
211 /// \brief Get current position (value)
212 value_type value() const;
213
214 /// \brief Get NULL status
215 bool is_null() const BMNOEXCEPT;
216
217 /// Returns true if iterator is at a valid position
218 bool valid() const BMNOEXCEPT { return pos_ != bm::id_max; }
219
220 /// Invalidate current iterator
221 void invalidate() BMNOEXCEPT { pos_ = bm::id_max; }
222
223 /// Current position (index) in the vector
224 size_type pos() const BMNOEXCEPT{ return pos_; }
225
226 /// re-position to a specified position
227 void go_to(size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT;
228
229 /// advance iterator forward by one
230 /// @return true if it is still valid
231 bool advance() BMNOEXCEPT;
232
233 void skip_zero_values() BMNOEXCEPT;
234
235 private:
236 const sparse_vector_type* sv_; ///!< ptr to parent
237 size_type pos_; ///!< Position
238 mutable buffer_type buffer_; ///!< value buffer
239 mutable value_type* buf_ptr_; ///!< position in the buffer
240 };
241
242 /**
243 Back insert iterator implements buffered insert, faster than generic
244 access assignment.
245
246 Limitations for buffered inserter:
247 1. Do not use more than one inserter per vector at a time
248 2. Use method flush() at the end to send the rest of accumulated buffer
249 flush is happening automatically on destruction, but if flush produces an
250 exception (for whatever reason) it will be an exception in destructor.
251 As such, explicit flush() is safer way to finilize the sparse vector load.
252
253 @ingroup sv
254 */
255 class back_insert_iterator
256 {
257 public:
258#ifndef BM_NO_STL
259 typedef std::output_iterator_tag iterator_category;
260#endif
261 typedef sparse_vector<Val, BV> sparse_vector_type;
262 typedef sparse_vector_type* sparse_vector_type_ptr;
263 typedef typename sparse_vector_type::value_type value_type;
264 typedef typename sparse_vector_type::unsigned_value_type unsigned_value_type;
265 typedef typename sparse_vector_type::size_type size_type;
266 typedef typename sparse_vector_type::bvector_type bvector_type;
267 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type allocator_type;
268 typedef typename bvector_type::allocator_type::allocator_pool_type allocator_pool_type;
269 typedef bm::byte_buffer<allocator_type> buffer_type;
270
271 typedef void difference_type;
272 typedef void pointer;
273 typedef void reference;
274
275 public:
276 /*! @name Construction and assignment */
277 ///@{
278
279 back_insert_iterator();
280 back_insert_iterator(sparse_vector_type* sv);
281 back_insert_iterator(const back_insert_iterator& bi);
282
283 /*back_insert_iterator&*/ void operator=(const back_insert_iterator& bi)
284 {
285 BM_ASSERT(bi.empty());
286 this->flush(); sv_ = bi.sv_; bv_null_ = bi.bv_null_;
287 buffer_.reserve(n_buf_size * sizeof(value_type));
288 buf_ptr_ = (unsigned_value_type*)(buffer_.data());
289 this->set_not_null_ = bi.set_not_null_;
290 //return *this;
291 }
292 /** move constructor */
293 back_insert_iterator(back_insert_iterator&& bi) BMNOEXCEPT;
294 /** move assignment*/
295 /*back_insert_iterator&*/void operator= (back_insert_iterator&& bi) BMNOEXCEPT
296 {
297 this->flush(); sv_ = bi.sv_; bv_null_ = bi.bv_null_;
298 this->buffer_.swap(bi.buffer_);
299 this->buf_ptr_ = bi.buf_ptr_;
300 this->set_not_null_ = bi.set_not_null_;
301 //return *this;
302 }
303
304 ~~back_insert_iterator();
305 ///@}
306
307
308 /** push value to the vector */
309 //back_insert_iterator&
310 void operator=(value_type v) { this->add(v); /*return *this;*/ }
311 /** noop */
312 back_insert_iterator& operator*() { return *this; }
313 /** noop */
314 back_insert_iterator& operator++() { return *this; }
315 /** noop */
316 back_insert_iterator& operator++( int ) { return *this; }
317
318 /** add value to the container*/
319 void add(value_type v);
320
321 /** add NULL (no-value) to the container */
322 void add_null();
323
324 /** add a series of consequitve NULLs (no-value) to the container */
325 void add_null(size_type count);
326
327 /** return true if insertion buffer is empty */
328 bool empty() const;
329
330 /** flush the accumulated buffer
331 @return true if actually flushed (back inserter had data to flush)
332 */
333 bool flush();
334
335 // ---------------------------------------------------------------
336 // open internals
337 // (TODO: create proper friend declarations)
338 //
339 /**
340 Get access to not-null vector
341 @internal
342 */
343 bvector_type* get_null_bvect() const BMNOEXCEPT { return bv_null_; }
344
345 /** add value to the buffer without changing the NULL vector
346 @param v - value to push back
347 @internal
348 */
349 void add_value_no_null(value_type v);
350
351 /**
352 Reconfigure back inserter not to touch the NULL vector
353 */
354 void disable_set_null() BMNOEXCEPT { set_not_null_ = false; }
355 // ---------------------------------------------------------------
356
357 protected:
358 typedef typename bvector_type::block_idx_type block_idx_type;
359
360 private:
361 bm::sparse_vector<Val, BV>* sv_; ///!< pointer on the parent vector
362 bvector_type* bv_null_; ///!< not NULL vector pointer
363 buffer_type buffer_; ///!< value buffer
364 unsigned_value_type* buf_ptr_; ///!< position in the buffer
365 bool set_not_null_;
366 };
367
368 friend const_iterator;
369 friend back_insert_iterator;
370
371public:
372 // ------------------------------------------------------------
373 /*! @name Construction and assignment */
374 ///@{
375
376 /*!
377 \brief Sparse vector constructor
378
379 \param null_able - defines if vector supports NULL values flag
380 by default it is OFF, use bm::use_null to enable it
381 \param ap - allocation strategy for underlying bit-vectors
382 Default allocation policy uses BM_BIT setting (fastest access)
383 \param bv_max_size - maximum possible size of underlying bit-vectors
384 Please note, this is NOT size of svector itself, it is dynamic upper limit
385 which should be used very carefully if we surely know the ultimate size
386 \param alloc - allocator for bit-vectors
387
388 \sa bvector<>
389 \sa bm::bvector<>::allocation_policy
390 \sa bm::startegy
391 */
392 sparse_vector(bm::null_support null_able = bm::no_null,
393 allocation_policy_type ap = allocation_policy_type(),
394 size_type bv_max_size = bm::id_max,
395 const allocator_type& alloc = allocator_type());
396
397 /*! copy-ctor */
398 sparse_vector(const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv);
399
400 /*! copy assignmment operator */
401 sparse_vector<Val,BV>& operator = (const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv)
402 {
403 if (this != &sv)
404 parent_type::copy_from(sv);
405 return *this;
406 }
407
408 /*! move-ctor */
409 sparse_vector(sparse_vector<Val, BV>&& sv) BMNOEXCEPT;
410
411 /*! move assignmment operator */
412 sparse_vector<Val,BV>& operator = (sparse_vector<Val, BV>&& sv) BMNOEXCEPT
413 {
414 if (this != &sv)
415 {
416 clear_all(true);
417 swap(sv);
418 }
419 return *this;
420 }
421
422 ~sparse_vector() BMNOEXCEPT;
423 ///@}
424
425
426 // ------------------------------------------------------------
427 /*! @name Element access, editing */
428 ///@{
429
430 /** \brief Operator to get write access to an element */
431 reference operator[](size_type idx) BMNOEXCEPT
432 { return reference(*this, idx); }
433
434 /*!
435 \brief get specified element without bounds checking
436 \param idx - element index
437 \return value of the element
438 */
439 value_type operator[](size_type idx) const BMNOEXCEPT
440 { return this->get(idx); }
441
442 /*!
443 \brief access specified element with bounds checking
444 \param idx - element index
445 \return value of the element
446 */
447 value_type at(size_type idx) const;
448 /*!
449 \brief get specified element without bounds checking
450 \param idx - element index
451 \return value of the element
452 */
453 value_type get(size_type idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
454
455
456 /*!
457 \brief get specified element without checking boundary conditions
458 \param idx - element index
459 \return value of the element
460 */
461 value_type get_no_check(size_type idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
462
463 /**
464 \brief get specified element with NOT NULL check
465 \param idx - element index
466 \param v - [out] value to get
467 \return true if value was aquired (NOT NULL), false otherwise
468 @sa is_null, get
469 */
470 bool try_get(size_type idx, value_type& v) const BMNOEXCEPT;
471
472 /*!
473 \brief set specified element with bounds checking and automatic resize
474 \param idx - element index
475 \param v - element value
476 */
477 void set(size_type idx, value_type v);
478
479 /*!
480 \brief increment specified element by one
481 \param idx - element index
482 */
483 void inc(size_type idx);
484
485 /*!
486 \brief push value back into vector
487 \param v - element value
488 */
489 void push_back(value_type v);
490
491 /*!
492 \brief push back specified amount of NULL values
493 \param count - number of NULLs to push back
494 */
495 void push_back_null(size_type count);
496
497 /*!
498 \brief push back NULL value
499 */
500 void push_back_null() { push_back_null(1); }
501
502 /*!
503 \brief insert specified element into container
504 \param idx - element index
505 \param v - element value
506 */
507 void insert(size_type idx, value_type v);
508
509 /*!
510 \brief erase specified element from container
511 \param idx - element index
512 \param erase_null - erase the NULL vector (if exists) (default: true)
513 */
514 void erase(size_type idx, bool erase_null = true);
515
516 /*!
517 \brief clear specified element with bounds checking and automatic resize
518 \param idx - element index
519 \param set_null - if true the value receives NULL (unassigned) value
520 */
521 void clear(size_type idx, bool set_null/* = false*/);
522
523 /** \brief set specified element to unassigned value (NULL)
524 \param idx - element index
525 */
526 void set_null(size_type idx);
527
528 /**
529 Set NULL all elements set as 1 in the argument vector.
530 Function also clears all the values to 0.
531 \param bv_idx - index bit-vector for elements which to be set to NULL
532 */
533 void set_null(const bvector_type& bv_idx)
534 { this->bit_sub_rows(bv_idx, true); }
535
536 /**
537 Set vector elements spcified by argument bit-vector to zero
538 Note that set to 0 elements are NOT going to tuned to NULL (NULL qualifier is preserved)
539 \param bv_idx - index bit-vector for elements which to be set to 0
540 */
541 void clear(const bvector_type& bv_idx)
542 { this->bit_sub_rows(bv_idx, false); }
543
544
545 ///@}
546
547 // ------------------------------------------------------------
548 /*! @name Iterator access */
549 ///@{
550
551 /** Provide const iterator access to container content */
552 const_iterator begin() const BMNOEXCEPT;
553
554 /** Provide const iterator access to the end */
555 const_iterator end() const BMNOEXCEPT
556 { return const_iterator(this, bm::id_max); }
557
558 /** Get const_itertor re-positioned to specific element
559 @param idx - position in the sparse vector
560 */
561 const_iterator get_const_iterator(size_type idx) const BMNOEXCEPT
562 { return const_iterator(this, idx); }
563
564 /** Provide back insert iterator
565 Back insert iterator implements buffered insertion,
566 which is faster, than random access or push_back
567 */
568 back_insert_iterator get_back_inserter()
569 { return back_insert_iterator(this); }
570 ///@}

576
577 /** \brief various type traits

579 static constexpr
580 bool is_compressed() BMNOEXCEPT { return false; }
581
582 static constexpr
583 bool is_str() BMNOEXCEPT { return false; }

588 // ------------------------------------------------------------
589 /*! @name Loading of sparse vector from C-style array */
590 ///@{
591
592 /*!
593 \brief Import list of elements from a C-style array
594 \param arr - source array
595 \param arr_size - source size
596 \param offset - target index in the sparse vector
597 \param set_not_null - import should register in not null vector
598 */
599 void import(const value_type* arr,
600 size_type arr_size,
601 size_type offset = 0,
602 bool set_not_null = true);
603
604 /*!
605 \brief Import list of elements from a C-style array (pushed back)
606 \param arr - source array
607 \param arr_size - source array size
608 \param set_not_null - import should register in not null vector
609 */
610 void import_back(const value_type* arr,
611 size_type arr_size,
612 bool set_not_null = true);
613 ///@}
614
615 // ------------------------------------------------------------
616 /*! @name Export content to C-style array */
617 ///@{
618
619 /*!
620 \brief Bulk export list of elements to a C-style array
621
622 For efficiency, this is left as a low level function,
623 it does not do any bounds checking on the target array, it will
624 override memory and crash if you are not careful with allocation
625 and request size.
626
627 \param arr - dest array
628 \param idx_from - index in the sparse vector to export from
629 \param dec_size - decoding size (array allocation should match)
630 \param zero_mem - set to false if target array is pre-initialized
631 with 0s to avoid performance penalty
632
633 \return number of actually exported elements (can be less than requested)
634
635 \sa gather
636 */
637 size_type decode(value_type* arr,
638 size_type idx_from,
639 size_type dec_size,
640 bool zero_mem = true) const;
641
642
643 /*!
644 \brief Gather elements to a C-style array
645
646 Gather collects values from different locations, for best
647 performance feed it with sorted list of indexes.
648
649 Faster than one-by-one random access.
650
651 For efficiency, this is left as a low level function,
652 it does not do any bounds checking on the target array, it will
653 override memory and crash if you are not careful with allocation
654 and request size.
655
656 \param arr - dest array
657 \param idx - index list to gather elements
658 \param size - decoding index list size (array allocation should match)
659 \param sorted_idx - sort order directive for the idx array
660 (BM_UNSORTED, BM_SORTED, BM_UNKNOWN)
661 Sort order affects both performance and correctness(!), use BM_UNKNOWN
662 if not sure.
663
664 \return number of actually exported elements (can be less than requested)
665
666 \sa decode
667 */
668 size_type gather(value_type* arr,
669 const size_type* idx,
670 size_type size,
671 bm::sort_order sorted_idx) const;
672 ///@}
673
674 /*! \brief content exchange
675 */
676 void swap(sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv) BMNOEXCEPT;
677
678 // ------------------------------------------------------------
679 /*! @name Clear */
680 ///@{
681
682 /*! \brief resize to zero, free memory */
683 void clear_all(bool free_mem) BMNOEXCEPT;
684
685 /*! \brief resize to zero, free memory */
686 void clear() BMNOEXCEPT { clear_all(true); }
687
688 /*!
689 \brief clear range (assign bit 0 for all planes)
690 \param left - interval start
691 \param right - interval end (closed interval)
692 \param set_null - set cleared values to unassigned (NULL)
693 */
694 sparse_vector<Val, BV>& clear_range(size_type left,
695 size_type right,
696 bool set_null = false);
697
698 ///@}
699
700 // ------------------------------------------------------------
701 /*! @name Size, etc */
702 ///@{
703
704 /*! \brief return size of the vector
705 \return size of sparse vector
706 */
707 size_type size() const BMNOEXCEPT { return this->size_; }
708
709 /*! \brief return true if vector is empty
710 \return true if empty
711 */
712 bool empty() const BMNOEXCEPT { return (size() == 0); }
713
714 /*! \brief resize vector
715 \param sz - new size
716 */
717 void resize(size_type sz) { parent_type::resize(sz, true); }
718
719 /**
720 \brief recalculate size to exclude tail NULL elements
721 After this call size() will return the true size of the vector
722 */
723 void sync_size() BMNOEXCEPT;
724
725 ///@}
726
727 // ------------------------------------------------------------
728 /*! @name Comparison */
729 ///@{
730
731 /*!
732 \brief check if another sparse vector has the same content and size
733
734 \param sv - sparse vector for comparison
735 \param null_able - flag to consider NULL vector in comparison (default)
736 or compare only value content planes
737
738 \return true, if it is the same
739 */
740 bool equal(const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv,
741 bm::null_support null_able = bm::use_null) const BMNOEXCEPT;
742
743 ///@}
744
745 // ------------------------------------------------------------
746 /*! @name Element comparison */
747 ///@{
748
749 /**
750 \brief Compare vector element with argument
751
752 \param idx - vactor element index
753 \param val - argument to compare with
754
755 \return 0 - equal, < 0 - vect[i] < val, >0 otherwise
756 */
757 int compare(size_type idx, const value_type val) const BMNOEXCEPT;
758
759 ///@}
760
761 // ------------------------------------------------------------
762 /*! @name Memory optimization */
763 ///@{
764
765 /*!
766 \brief run memory optimization for all vector planes
767 \param temp_block - pre-allocated memory block to avoid unnecessary re-allocs
768 \param opt_mode - requested compression depth
769 \param stat - memory allocation statistics after optimization
770 */
771 void optimize(bm::word_t* temp_block = 0,
772 typename bvector_type::optmode opt_mode = bvector_type::opt_compress,
773 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::statistics* stat = 0);
774
775 /*!
776 \brief Optimize sizes of GAP blocks
777
778 This method runs an analysis to find optimal GAP levels for all bit planes
779 of the vector.
780 */
781 void optimize_gap_size();
782
783 /*!
784 @brief Calculates memory statistics.
785
786 Function fills statistics structure containing information about how
787 this vector uses memory and estimation of max. amount of memory
788 bvector needs to serialize itself.
789
790 @param st - pointer on statistics structure to be filled in.
791
792 @sa statistics
793 */
794 void calc_stat(
795 struct sparse_vector<Val, BV>::statistics* st) const BMNOEXCEPT;
796
797 /**
798 @brief Turn sparse vector into immutable mode
799 Read-only (immutable) vector uses less memory and allows faster searches.
800 Before freezing it is recommenede to call optimize() to get full memory saving effect
801 @sa optimize
802 */
803 void freeze() { this->freeze_matr(); }
804
805 /** Returns true if vector is read-only */
806 bool is_ro() const BMNOEXCEPT { return this->is_ro_; }
807
808 ///@}
809
810 // ------------------------------------------------------------
811 /*! @name Merge, split, partition data */
812 ///@{
813
814 /*!
815 \brief join all with another sparse vector using OR operation
816 \param sv - argument vector to join with
817 \return slf reference
818 @sa merge
819 */
820 sparse_vector<Val, BV>& join(const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv);
821
822 /*!
823 \brief merge with another sparse vector using OR operation
824 Merge is different from join(), because it borrows data from the source
825 vector, so it gets modified.
826
827 \param sv - [in, out]argument vector to join with (vector mutates)
828
829 \return slf reference
830 @sa join
831 */
832 sparse_vector<Val, BV>& merge(sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv);
833
834
835 /**
836 @brief copy range of values from another sparse vector
837
838 Copy [left..right] values from the source vector,
839 clear everything outside the range.
840
841 \param sv - source vector
842 \param left - index from in losed diapason of [left..right]
843 \param right - index to in losed diapason of [left..right]
844 \param slice_null - "use_null" copy range for NULL vector or
845 do not copy it
846 */
847 void copy_range(const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv,
848 size_type left, size_type right,
849 bm::null_support slice_null = bm::use_null);
850
851
852 /**
853 Keep only specified interval in the sparse vector, clear all other
854 elements.
855
856 \param left - interval start
857 \param right - interval end (closed interval)
858 \param slice_null - "use_null" copy range for NULL vector or not
859 */
860 void keep_range(size_type left, size_type right,
861 bm::null_support slice_null = bm::use_null);
862
863 /**
864 @brief Apply value filter, defined by mask vector
865
866 All bit-planes are ANDed against the filter mask.
867 */
868 void filter(const bvector_type& bv_mask);
869
870 ///@}
871
872
873 // ------------------------------------------------------------
874 /*! @name Access to internals */
875 ///@{
876
877
878 /*! \brief syncronize internal structures, build fast access index
879 */
880 void sync(bool /*force*/) {}
881
882
883 /*!
884 \brief Bulk export list of elements to a C-style array
885
886 Use of all extract() methods is restricted.
887 Please consider decode() for the same purpose.
888
889 \param arr - dest array
890 \param size - dest size
891 \param offset - target index in the sparse vector to export from
892 \param zero_mem - set to false if target array is pre-initialized
893 with 0s to avoid performance penalty
894 \return effective size(number) of exported elements
895
896 \sa decode
897
898 @internal
899 */
900 size_type extract(value_type* arr,
901 size_type size,
902 size_type offset = 0,
903 bool zero_mem = true) const BMNOEXCEPT2;
904
905 /** \brief extract small window without use of masking vector
906 \sa decode
907 @internal
908 */
909 size_type extract_range(value_type* arr,
910 size_type size,
911 size_type offset,
912 bool zero_mem = true) const;
913
914 /** \brief extract medium window without use of masking vector
915 \sa decode
916 @internal
917 */
918 size_type extract_planes(value_type* arr,
919 size_type size,
920 size_type offset,
921 bool zero_mem = true) const;
922
923 /** \brief address translation for this type of container
924 \internal
925 */
926 static
927 size_type translate_address(size_type i) BMNOEXCEPT { return i; }
928
929 /**
930 \brief throw range error
931 \internal
932 */
933 static
934 void throw_range_error(const char* err_msg);
935
936 /**
937 \brief throw bad alloc
938 \internal
939 */
940 static
941 void throw_bad_alloc();
942
943
944 /**
945 \brief find position of compressed element by its rank
946 */
947 static
948 bool find_rank(size_type rank, size_type& pos) BMNOEXCEPT;
949
950 /**
951 \brief size of sparse vector (may be different for RSC)
952 */
953 size_type effective_size() const BMNOEXCEPT { return size(); }
954
955 /**
956 \brief Always 1 (non-matrix type)
957 */
958 size_type effective_vector_max() const BMNOEXCEPT { return 1; }
959
960 ///@}
961
962 /// Set allocator pool for local (non-threaded)
963 /// memory cyclic(lots of alloc-free ops) opertations
964 ///
965 void set_allocator_pool(allocator_pool_type* pool_ptr) BMNOEXCEPT;
966
967protected:
968 enum octet_slices
969 {
970 sv_octet_slices = sizeof(value_type)
971 };
972 enum buf_size_e
973 {
974 n_buf_size = 1024 * 8
975 };
976
977
978 /*! \brief set value without checking boundaries */
979 void set_value(size_type idx, value_type v, bool need_clear);
980
981 /*! \brief set value without checking boundaries or support of NULL
982 @param idx - element index
983 @param v - value to set
984 @param need_clear - if clear 0 bits is necessary
985 (or not if vector is resized)
986 */
987 void set_value_no_null(size_type idx, value_type v, bool need_clear);
988
989 /*! \brief push value back into vector without NULL semantics */
990 void push_back_no_null(value_type v);
991
992 /*! \brief insert value without checking boundaries */
993 void insert_value(size_type idx, value_type v);
994 /*! \brief insert value without checking boundaries or support of NULL */
995 void insert_value_no_null(size_type idx, value_type v);
996
997 void resize_internal(size_type sz, bool set_null=true)
998 { parent_type::resize(sz, set_null); }
999 size_type size_internal() const BMNOEXCEPT { return size(); }
1000
1001 constexpr bool is_remap() const BMNOEXCEPT { return false; }
1002 size_t remap_size() const BMNOEXCEPT { return 0; }
1003 const unsigned char* get_remap_buffer() const BMNOEXCEPT { return 0; }
1004 unsigned char* init_remap_buffer() BMNOEXCEPT { return 0; }
1005 void set_remap() BMNOEXCEPT { }
1006
1007 /// unused remap matrix type for compatibility with the sparse serializer
1008 typedef
1009 bm::heap_matrix<unsigned char,
1010 sizeof(value_type), /* ROWS */
1011 256, /* COLS = number of chars in the ASCII set */
1012 typename bvector_type::allocator_type>
1013 remap_matrix_type;
1014
1015 const remap_matrix_type* get_remap_matrix() const { return 0; }
1016 remap_matrix_type* get_remap_matrix() { return 0; }
1017
1018 bool resolve_range(size_type from, size_type to,
1019 size_type* idx_from, size_type* idx_to) const BMNOEXCEPT
1020 {
1021 *idx_from = from; *idx_to = to; return true;
1022 }
1023
1024 /// Increment element by 1 without chnaging NULL vector or size
1025 void inc_no_null(size_type idx);
1026
1027 /// increment by v without chnaging NULL vector or size
1028 void inc_no_null(size_type idx, value_type v);
1029
1030 /*!
1031 \brief Import list of elements from a C-style array (pushed back)
1032 \param arr - source array
1033 \param arr_size - source array size
1034 \param set_not_null - import should register in not null vector
1035 */
1036 void import_back_u(const unsigned_value_type* arr,
1037 size_type arr_size,
1038 bool set_not_null = true);
1039
1040 /*!
1041 \brief Import list of elements from a C-style array
1042 \param arr - source array
1043 \param arr_size - source size
1044 \param offset - target index in the sparse vector
1045 \param set_not_null - import should register in not null vector
1046 */
1047 void import_u(const unsigned_value_type* arr,
1048 size_type arr_size, size_type offset,
1049 bool set_not_null);
1050
1051 void import_u_nocheck(const unsigned_value_type* arr,
1052 size_type arr_size, size_type offset,
1053 bool set_not_null);
1054
1055 void join_null_slice(const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv);
1056
1057 static
1058 void u2s_translate(value_type* arr, size_type sz) BMNOEXCEPT;
1059
1060 // get raw unsigned value
1061 unsigned_value_type get_unsigned(size_type idx) const BMNOEXCEPT;
1062
1063protected:
1064 template<class V, class SV> friend class rsc_sparse_vector;
1065 template<class SVect> friend class sparse_vector_scanner;
1066 template<class SVect> friend class sparse_vector_serializer;
1067 template<class SVect> friend class sparse_vector_deserializer;
1068
1069
1070};
1071

1102#endif

1116 parent_type::swap(sv);
1117}

1119//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1120
1121template<class Val, class BV>
1122void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::throw_range_error(const char* err_msg)
1123{
1124#ifndef BM_NO_STL
1125 throw std::range_error(err_msg);
1126#else
1127 BM_ASSERT_THROW(false, BM_ERR_RANGE);
1128#endif
1129}

1131//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1132
1133template<class Val, class BV>
1134void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::throw_bad_alloc()
1135{
1136 BV::throw_bad_alloc();
1137}
1138
1139//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1140
1141template<class Val, class BV>
1142void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::set_null(size_type idx)
1143{
1144 clear(idx, true);
1145}
1146
1147//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1148
1149template<class Val, class BV>
1150void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::import(const value_type* arr,
1151 size_type arr_size,
1152 size_type offset,
1153 bool set_not_null)
1154{
1155 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
1156 {
1157 const unsigned tmp_size = 1024;
1158 unsigned_value_type arr_tmp[tmp_size];
1159 size_type k(0), i(0);
1160 while (i < arr_size)
1161 {
1162 arr_tmp[k++] = this->s2u(arr[i++]);
1163 if (k == tmp_size)
1164 {
1165 import_u(arr_tmp, k, offset, set_not_null);
1166 k = 0; offset += tmp_size;
1167 }
1168 } // while
1169 if (k)
1170 {
1171 import_u(arr_tmp, k, offset, set_not_null);
1172 }
1173 }
1174 else
1175 {
1176 import_u((const unsigned_value_type*) arr, arr_size, offset, set_not_null);
1177 }
1178}
1179
1180//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1181
1182template<class Val, class BV>
1183void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::import_u(const unsigned_value_type* arr,
1184 size_type arr_size,
1185 size_type offset,
1186 bool set_not_null)
1187{
1188 if (arr_size == 0)
1189 throw_range_error("sparse_vector range error (import size 0)");
1190
1191 // clear all planes in the range to provide corrrect import of 0 values
1192 if (offset < this->size_) // in case it touches existing elements
1193 this->clear_range(offset, offset + arr_size - 1);
1194
1195 this->import_u_nocheck(arr, arr_size, offset, set_not_null);
1196}
1197//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1198
1199template<class Val, class BV>
1200void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::import_u_nocheck
1201 (const unsigned_value_type* arr,
1202 size_type arr_size,
1203 size_type offset,
1204 bool set_not_null)
1205{
1206 BM_ASSERT(arr);
1207 const unsigned bit_capacity = sizeof(Val)*8;
1208 unsigned char b_list[bit_capacity];
1209 unsigned row_len[bit_capacity] = {0, };
1210 bvector_type_ptr bv_slices[bit_capacity] = {0, };
1211
1212 const unsigned transpose_window = 256; // L1-sized for 32-bit int
1213 bm::tmatrix<size_type, bit_capacity, transpose_window> tm; // matrix accumulator
1214
1215 // transposition algorithm uses bitscan to find index bits and store it
1216 // in temporary matrix (list for each bit plane), matrix here works
1217 // when array gets to big - the list gets loaded into bit-vector using
1218 // bulk load algorithm, which is faster than single bit access
1219 //
1220
1221 size_type i;
1222 for (i = 0; i < arr_size; ++i)
1223 {
1224 unsigned bcnt = bm::bitscan(arr[i], b_list);
1225 const size_type bit_idx = i + offset;
1226
1227 for (unsigned j = 0; j < bcnt; ++j)
1228 {
1229 unsigned p = b_list[j];
1230 unsigned rl = row_len[p];
1231 tm.row(p)[rl] = bit_idx;
1232 row_len[p] = ++rl;
1233
1234 if (rl == transpose_window)
1235 {
1236 bvector_type* bv = bv_slices[p];
1237 if (!bv)
1238 bv = bv_slices[p] = this->get_create_slice(p);
1239
1240 const size_type* r = tm.row(p);
1241 row_len[p] = 0;
1242 bv->import_sorted(r, rl);
1243
1244 }
1245 } // for j
1246 } // for i
1247
1248 // process incomplete transposition lines
1249 //
1250 unsigned rows = tm.rows();
1251 for (unsigned k = 0; k < rows; ++k)
1252 {
1253 if (unsigned rl = row_len[k])
1254 {
1255 bvector_type* bv = bv_slices[k];
1256 if (!bv)
1257 bv = this->get_create_slice(k);
1258 const size_type* row = tm.row(k);
1259 bv->import_sorted(row, rl);
1260 }
1261 } // for k
1262
1263
1264 if (i + offset > this->size_)
1265 this->size_ = i + offset;
1266
1267 if (set_not_null)
1268 {
1269 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
1270 bv_null->set_range(offset, offset + arr_size - 1);
1271 }
1272}
1273
1274
1275//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1276
1277template<class Val, class BV>
1278void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::sync_size() BMNOEXCEPT
1279{
1280 const bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvector();
1281 if (!bv_null)
1282 return;
1283 bool found = bv_null->find_reverse(this->size_);
1284 this->size_ += found;
1285}
1286
1287//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1288
1289template<class Val, class BV>
1290void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::import_back(const value_type* arr,
1291 size_type arr_size,
1292 bool set_not_null)
1293{
1294 if constexpr (std::is_signed<value_type>::value)
1295 {
1296 const unsigned tmp_size = 1024;
1297 unsigned_value_type arr_tmp[tmp_size];
1298 size_type k(0), i(0);
1299 while (i < arr_size)
1300 {
1301 arr_tmp[k++] = this->s2u(arr[i++]);
1302 if (k == tmp_size)
1303 {
1304 import_back_u(arr_tmp, k, set_not_null);
1305 k = 0;
1306 }
1307 } // while
1308 if (k)
1309 {
1310 import_back_u(arr_tmp, k, set_not_null);
1311 }
1312 }
1313 else
1314 {
1315 this->import_back_u((const unsigned_value_type*)arr, arr_size, set_not_null);
1316 }
1317}
1318
1319
1320//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1321
1322template<class Val, class BV>
1323void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::import_back_u(const unsigned_value_type* arr,
1324 size_type arr_size,
1325 bool set_not_null)
1326{
1327 this->import_u_nocheck(arr, arr_size, this->size(), set_not_null);
1328}
1329
1330//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1331
1332template<class Val, class BV>
1333typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type
1334sparse_vector<Val, BV>::decode(value_type* arr,
1335 size_type idx_from,
1336 size_type dec_size,
1337 bool zero_mem) const
1338{
1339 return extract(arr, dec_size, idx_from, zero_mem);
1340}
1341
1342//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1343
1344template<class Val, class BV>
1345typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type
1346sparse_vector<Val, BV>::gather(value_type* arr,
1347 const size_type* idx,
1348 size_type size,
1349 bm::sort_order sorted_idx) const
1350{
1351 BM_ASSERT(arr);
1352 BM_ASSERT(idx);
1353 BM_ASSERT(size);
1354
1355 if (size == 1) // corner case: get 1 value
1356 {
1357 arr[0] = this->get(idx[0]);
1358 return size;
1359 }
1360 ::memset(arr, 0, sizeof(value_type)*size);
1361
1362 for (size_type i = 0; i < size;)
1363 {
1364 bool sorted_block = true;
1365
1366 // look ahead for the depth of the same block
1367 // (speculate more than one index lookup per block)
1368 //
1369 block_idx_type nb = (idx[i] >> bm::set_block_shift);
1370 size_type r = i;
1371
1372 switch (sorted_idx)
1373 {
1374 case BM_UNKNOWN:
1375 {
1376 sorted_block = true; // initial assumption
1377 size_type idx_prev = idx[r];
1378 for (; (r < size) && (nb == (idx[r] >> bm::set_block_shift)); ++r)
1379 {
1380 if (sorted_block)
1381 {
1382 if (idx[r] < idx_prev) // sorted check
1383 sorted_block = false;
1384 idx_prev = idx[r];
1385 }
1386 } // for r
1387 }
1388 break;
1389 case BM_UNSORTED:
1390 sorted_block = false;
1391 for (; r < size; ++r)
1392 {
1393 block_idx_type nb_next = (idx[r] >> bm::set_block_shift);
1394 if (nb != nb_next)
1395 break;
1396 } // for r
1397 break;
1398 case BM_SORTED:
1399 #ifdef BM64ADDR
1400 r = bm::idx_arr_block_lookup_u64(idx, size, nb, r);
1401 #else
1402 r = bm::idx_arr_block_lookup_u32(idx, size, nb, r);
1403 #endif
1404 break;
1405 case BM_SORTED_UNIFORM:
1406 r = size;
1407 break;
1408 default:
1409 BM_ASSERT(0);
1410 } // switch
1411
1412 // single element hit, use random access
1413 if (r == i+1)
1414 {
1415 // (idx[i] < bm::id_max) ? is an out of bounds check
1416 // some code (RSC vector) uses it to
1417 // indicate NULL value and prsent it as 0
1418 //
1419 if (idx[i] < bm::id_max)
1420 {
1421 unsigned_value_type uv = this->get_unsigned(idx[i]);
1422 arr[i] = value_type(uv);
1423 }
1424 ++i;
1425 continue;
1426 }
1427
1428 // process block co-located elements at ones for best (CPU cache opt)
1429 //
1430 unsigned i0 = unsigned(nb >> bm::set_array_shift); // top block address
1431 unsigned j0 = unsigned(nb & bm::set_array_mask); // address in sub-block
1432
1433 unsigned eff_planes = this->effective_slices(); // TODO: get real effective planes for [i,j]
1434 BM_ASSERT(eff_planes <= (sizeof(value_type) * 8));
1435
1436 for (unsigned j = 0; j < eff_planes; ++j)
1437 {
1438 const bm::word_t* blk = this->bmatr_.get_block(j, i0, j0);
1439 if (!blk)
1440 continue;
1441 unsigned_value_type vm;
1442 const unsigned_value_type mask1 = 1u;
1443
1444 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1445 {
1446 vm = (mask1 << j);
1447 for (size_type k = i; k < r; ++k)
1448 ((unsigned_value_type*)arr)[k] |= vm;
1449 continue;
1450 }
1451 if (BM_IS_GAP(blk))
1452 {
1453 const bm::gap_word_t* gap_blk = BMGAP_PTR(blk);
1454 unsigned is_set;
1455
1456 if (sorted_block) // b-search hybrid with scan lookup
1457 {
1458 for (size_type k = i; k < r; )
1459 {
1460 unsigned nbit = unsigned(idx[k] & bm::set_block_mask);
1461
1462 unsigned gidx = bm::gap_bfind(gap_blk, nbit, &is_set);
1463 unsigned gap_value = gap_blk[gidx];
1464 if (is_set)
1465 {
1466 ((unsigned_value_type*)arr)[k] |= vm = (mask1 << j);
1467 for (++k; k < r; ++k) // speculative look-up
1468 {
1469 if (unsigned(idx[k] & bm::set_block_mask) <= gap_value)
1470 ((unsigned_value_type*)arr)[k] |= vm;
1471 else
1472 break;
1473 }
1474 }
1475 else // 0 GAP - skip. not set
1476 {
1477 for (++k;
1478 (k < r) &&
1479 (unsigned(idx[k] & bm::set_block_mask) <= gap_value);
1480 ++k) {}
1481 }
1482 } // for k
1483 }
1484 else // unsorted block gather request: b-search lookup
1485 {
1486 for (size_type k = i; k < r; ++k)
1487 {
1488 unsigned nbit = unsigned(idx[k] & bm::set_block_mask);
1489 is_set = bm::gap_test_unr(gap_blk, nbit);
1490 ((unsigned_value_type*)arr)[k] |= (unsigned_value_type(bool(is_set)) << j);
1491 } // for k
1492 }
1493 continue;
1494 }
1495 bm::bit_block_gather_scatter((unsigned_value_type*)arr, blk, idx, r, i, j);
1496 } // for (each plane)
1497
1498 i = r;
1499
1500 } // for i
1501
1502 if constexpr (parent_type::is_signed())
1503 u2s_translate(arr, size);
1504
1505 return size;
1506}
1507
1508//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1509
1510template<class Val, class BV>
1511typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type
1512sparse_vector<Val, BV>::extract_range(value_type* arr,
1513 size_type size,
1514 size_type offset,
1515 bool zero_mem) const
1516{
1517 if (size == 0)
1518 return 0;
1519 if (zero_mem)
1520 ::memset(arr, 0, sizeof(value_type)*size);
1521
1522 size_type start = offset;
1523 size_type end = start + size;
1524 if (end > this->size_)
1525 end = this->size_;
1526
1527 // calculate logical block coordinates and masks
1528 //
1529 block_idx_type nb = (start >> bm::set_block_shift);
1530 unsigned i0 = unsigned(nb >> bm::set_array_shift); // top block address
1531 unsigned j0 = unsigned(nb & bm::set_array_mask); // address in sub-block
1532 unsigned nbit = unsigned(start & bm::set_block_mask);
1533 unsigned nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
1534 unsigned mask0 = 1u << (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
1535 const bm::word_t* blk = 0;
1536 unsigned is_set;
1537
1538 auto planes = this->effective_slices();
1539 BM_ASSERT(planes <= (sizeof(value_type) * 8));
1540
1541 for (unsigned j = 0; j < planes; ++j)
1542 {
1543 blk = this->bmatr_.get_block(j, i0, j0);
1544 bool is_gap = BM_IS_GAP(blk);
1545
1546 for (size_type k = start; k < end; ++k)
1547 {
1548 block_idx_type nb1 = (k >> bm::set_block_shift);
1549 if (nb1 != nb) // block switch boundaries
1550 {
1551 nb = nb1;
1552 i0 = unsigned(nb >> bm::set_array_shift);
1553 j0 = unsigned(nb & bm::set_array_mask);
1554 blk = this->bmatr_.get_block(j, i0, j0);
1555 is_gap = BM_IS_GAP(blk);
1556 }
1557 if (!blk)
1558 continue;
1559 nbit = unsigned(k & bm::set_block_mask);
1560 if (is_gap)
1561 {
1562 is_set = bm::gap_test_unr(BMGAP_PTR(blk), nbit);
1563 }
1564 else
1565 {
1566 if (blk == FULL_BLOCK_FAKE_ADDR)
1567 {
1568 is_set = 1;
1569 }
1570 else
1571 {
1572 BM_ASSERT(!IS_FULL_BLOCK(blk));
1573 nword = unsigned(nbit >> bm::set_word_shift);
1574 mask0 = 1u << (nbit & bm::set_word_mask);
1575 is_set = (blk[nword] & mask0);
1576 }
1577 }
1578 size_type idx = k - offset;
1579 unsigned_value_type vm = (bool) is_set;
1580 vm <<= j;
1581 arr[idx] |= vm;
1582
1583 } // for k
1584
1585 } // for j
1586
1587 if constexpr (parent_type::is_signed())
1588 u2s_translate(arr, size);
1589
1590 return 0;
1591}
1592
1593//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1594
1595template<class Val, class BV>
1596typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type
1597sparse_vector<Val, BV>::extract_planes(value_type* arr,
1598 size_type size,
1599 size_type offset,
1600 bool zero_mem) const
1601{
1602 if (size == 0)
1603 return 0;
1604
1605 if (zero_mem)
1606 ::memset(arr, 0, sizeof(value_type)*size);
1607
1608 size_type start = offset;
1609 size_type end = start + size;
1610 if (end > this->size_)
1611 end = this->size_;
1612
1613 for (size_type i = 0; i < parent_type::value_bits(); ++i)
1614 {
1615 const bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(i);
1616 if (!bv)
1617 continue;
1618
1619 unsigned_value_type mask = 1u << i;
1620 typename BV::enumerator en(bv, offset);
1621 for (;en.valid(); ++en)
1622 {
1623 size_type idx = *en - offset;
1624 if (idx >= size)
1625 break;
1626 arr[idx] |= mask;
1627 } // for
1628
1629 } // for i
1630
1631 return 0;
1632}
1633
1634
1635//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1636
1637template<class Val, class BV>
1638typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type
1639sparse_vector<Val, BV>::extract(value_type* BMRESTRICT arr,
1640 size_type size,
1641 size_type offset,
1642 bool zero_mem) const BMNOEXCEPT2
1643{
1644 /// Decoder functor
1645 /// @internal
1646 struct sv_decode_visitor_func
1647 {
1648 sv_decode_visitor_func(value_type* BMRESTRICT varr,
1649 unsigned_value_type mask,
1650 size_type off) BMNOEXCEPT2
1651 : arr_(varr), mask_(mask), sv_off_(off)
1652 {}
1653
1654 int add_bits(size_type bv_offset,
1655 const unsigned char* BMRESTRICT bits,
1656 unsigned bits_size) BMNOEXCEPT
1657 {
1658 // can be negative (-1) when bv base offset = 0 and sv = 1,2..
1659 size_type base = bv_offset - sv_off_;
1660 unsigned_value_type m = mask_;
1661 for (unsigned i = 0; i < bits_size; ++i)
1662 arr_[bits[i] + base] |= m;
1663 return 0;
1664 }
1665 int add_range(size_type bv_offset, size_type sz) BMNOEXCEPT
1666 {
1667 auto base = bv_offset - sv_off_;
1668 unsigned_value_type m = mask_;
1669 for (size_type i = 0; i < sz; ++i)
1670 arr_[i + base] |= m;
1671 return 0;
1672 }
1673
1674 value_type* BMRESTRICT arr_; ///< target array for de-transpose
1675 unsigned_value_type mask_; ///< bit-plane mask
1676 size_type sv_off_; ///< SV read offset
1677 };
1678
1679 if (!size)
1680 return 0;
1681
1682 if (zero_mem)
1683 ::memset(arr, 0, sizeof(value_type)*size);
1684
1685 size_type end = offset + size;
1686 if (end > this->size_)
1687 end = this->size_;
1688
1689 sv_decode_visitor_func func(arr, 0, offset);
1690
1691 auto planes = this->effective_slices();
1692 BM_ASSERT(planes <= (sizeof(value_type) * 8));
1693 for (size_type i = 0; i < planes; ++i)
1694 {
1695 if (const bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(i))
1696 {
1697 func.mask_ = (unsigned_value_type(1) << i); // set target plane OR mask
1698 bm::for_each_bit_range_no_check(*bv, offset, end-1, func);
1699 }
1700 } // for i
1701
1702 const size_type exported_size = end - offset;
1703 if constexpr (parent_type::is_signed())
1704 u2s_translate(arr, exported_size);
1705 return exported_size;
1706}
1707
1708//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1709
1710template<class Val, class BV>
1711void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::u2s_translate(value_type* arr, size_type sz) BMNOEXCEPT
1712{
1713 for (size_type i = 0; i < sz; ++i)
1714 {
1715 unsigned_value_type uv;
1716 ::memcpy(&uv, &arr[i], sizeof(uv));
1717 arr[i] = parent_type::u2s(uv);
1718 } // for i
1719}
1720
1721
1722//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1723
1724template<class Val, class BV>
1725typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::value_type
1726sparse_vector<Val, BV>::at(typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type idx) const
1727{
1728 if (idx >= this->size_)
1729 throw_range_error("sparse vector range error");
1730 return this->get(idx);
1731}
1732
1733//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1734
1735template<class Val, class BV>
1736typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::value_type
1737sparse_vector<Val, BV>::get(
1738 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type i) const BMNOEXCEPT
1739{
1740 BM_ASSERT(i < size());
1741 return get_no_check(i);
1742}
1743
1744//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1745
1746template<class Val, class BV>
1747typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::value_type
1748sparse_vector<Val, BV>::get_no_check(
1749 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type i) const BMNOEXCEPT
1750{
1751 unsigned_value_type uv = get_unsigned(i);
1752 if constexpr (parent_type::is_signed())
1753 return this->u2s(uv);
1754 else
1755 return uv;
1756}
1757
1758//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1759
1760template<class Val, class BV>
1761typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::unsigned_value_type
1762sparse_vector<Val, BV>::get_unsigned(
1763 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type i) const BMNOEXCEPT
1764{
1765 BM_ASSERT(i < bm::id_max);
1766
1767 unsigned_value_type uv = 0;
1768 unsigned eff_planes = this->effective_slices();
1769 BM_ASSERT(eff_planes <= (sizeof(value_type) * 8));
1770
1771 unsigned_value_type smask = this->slice_mask_;
1772 for (unsigned j = 0; smask && j < eff_planes; j+=4, smask >>= 4)
1773 {
1774 if (smask & 0x0F) // b1111
1775 {
1776 unsigned_value_type vm =
1777 (unsigned_value_type)this->bmatr_.get_half_octet(i, j);
1778 uv |= unsigned_value_type(vm << j);
1779 }
1780 } // for j
1781 return uv;
1782}
1783
1784//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1785
1786template<class Val, class BV>
1787bool sparse_vector<Val, BV>::try_get(
1788 size_type idx, value_type& v) const BMNOEXCEPT
1789{
1790 if (this->is_null(idx))
1791 return false;
1792 v = get(idx);
1793 return true;
1794}
1795
1796
1797//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1798
1799template<class Val, class BV>
1800void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::set(size_type idx, value_type v)
1801{
1802 bool need_clear;
1803 if (idx >= size())
1804 {
1805 this->size_ = idx+1;
1806 need_clear = false;
1807 }
1808 else
1809 need_clear = true;
1810 set_value(idx, v, need_clear);
1811}
1812
1813//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1814
1815template<class Val, class BV>
1816void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::clear(size_type idx, bool set_null)
1817{
1818 if (idx >= size())
1819 this->size_ = idx+1; // assumed there is nothing to do outside the size
1820 else
1821 {
1822 set_value(idx, value_type(0), true);
1823 if (set_null)
1824 {
1825 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
1826 bv_null->clear_bit_no_check(idx);
1827 }
1828 }
1829}
1830
1831//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1832
1833template<class Val, class BV>
1834void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::push_back(value_type v)
1835{
1836 set_value(this->size_, v, false);
1837 ++(this->size_);
1838}
1839
1840//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1841
1842template<class Val, class BV>
1843void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::push_back_null(size_type count)
1844{
1845 BM_ASSERT(count);
1846 BM_ASSERT(bm::id_max - count > this->size_);
1847 BM_ASSERT(this->is_nullable());
1848
1849 this->size_ += count;
1850}
1851
1852
1853//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1854
1855template<class Val, class BV>
1856void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::insert(size_type idx, value_type v)
1857{
1858 if (idx >= size())
1859 {
1860 this->size_ = idx+1;
1861 set_value(idx, v, false);
1862 return;
1863 }
1864 insert_value(idx, v);
1865}
1866
1867//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1868
1869template<class Val, class BV>
1870void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::insert_value(size_type idx, value_type v)
1871{
1872 insert_value_no_null(idx, v);
1873 this->insert_null(idx, true);
1874}
1875
1876//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1877
1878template<class Val, class BV>
1879void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::insert_value_no_null(size_type idx, value_type v)
1880{
1881 unsigned_value_type uv = this->s2u(v);
1882 unsigned bsr = uv ? bm::bit_scan_reverse(uv) : 0u;
1883
1884 unsigned_value_type mask = 1u;
1885 unsigned i = 0;
1886 for (; i <= bsr; ++i)
1887 {
1888 if (uv & mask)
1889 {
1890 bvector_type* bv = this->get_create_slice(i);
1891 bv->insert(idx, true);
1892 }
1893 else
1894 {
1895 if (bvector_type_ptr bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(i))
1896 bv->insert(idx, false);
1897 }
1898 mask = unsigned_value_type(mask << 1);
1899 } // for i
1900
1901 // insert 0 into all other existing planes
1902 unsigned eff_planes = this->effective_slices();
1903 BM_ASSERT(eff_planes <= (sizeof(value_type) * 8));
1904 for (; i < eff_planes; ++i)
1905 {
1906 if (bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(i))
1907 bv->insert(idx, false);
1908 } // for i
1909 this->size_++;
1910}
1911
1912//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1913
1914template<class Val, class BV>
1915void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::erase(size_type idx, bool erase_null)
1916{
1917 BM_ASSERT(idx < this->size_);
1918 if (idx >= this->size_)
1919 return;
1920 this->erase_column(idx, erase_null);
1921 this->size_ -= erase_null;
1922}
1923
1924
1925//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1926
1927template<class Val, class BV>
1928void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::push_back_no_null(value_type v)
1929{
1930 set_value_no_null(this->size_, v, false);
1931 ++(this->size_);
1932}
1933
1934//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1935
1936template<class Val, class BV>
1937void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::set_value(size_type idx,
1938 value_type v, bool need_clear)
1939{
1940 set_value_no_null(idx, v, need_clear);
1941 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
1942 bv_null->set_bit_no_check(idx);
1943}
1944
1945//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1946
1947template<class Val, class BV>
1948void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::set_value_no_null(size_type idx,
1949 value_type v, bool need_clear)
1950{
1951 unsigned_value_type uv = this->s2u(v);
1952
1953 // calculate logical block coordinates and masks
1954 //
1955 block_idx_type nb = (idx >> bm::set_block_shift);
1956 unsigned i0 = unsigned(nb >> bm::set_array_shift); // top block address
1957 unsigned j0 = unsigned(nb & bm::set_array_mask); // address in sub-block
1958
1959 // clear the planes where needed
1960 unsigned bsr = uv ? bm::bit_scan_reverse(uv) : 0u;
1961 if (need_clear)
1962 {
1963 unsigned eff_planes = this->effective_slices();
1964 BM_ASSERT(eff_planes <= (sizeof(value_type) * 8));
1965 this->bmatr_.clear_slices_range(bsr, eff_planes, idx);
1966 }
1967 if (uv)
1968 {
1969 unsigned_value_type mask = 1u;
1970 for (unsigned j = 0; j <= bsr; ++j)
1971 {
1972 if (uv & mask)
1973 {
1974 bvector_type* bv = this->get_create_slice(j);
1975 bv->set_bit_no_check(idx);
1976 }
1977 else if (need_clear)
1978 {
1979 if (const bm::word_t* blk = this->bmatr_.get_block(j, i0, j0))
1980 {
1981 // TODO: more efficient set/clear on on block
1982 bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(j);
1983 bv->clear_bit_no_check(idx);
1984 }
1985 }
1986 mask <<= 1u;
1987 } // for j
1988 }
1989}
1990
1991//---------------------------------------------------------------------
1992
1993template<class Val, class BV>
1994void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::inc(size_type idx)
1995{
1996 if (idx >= this->size_)
1997 {
1998 this->size_ = idx+1;
1999 set_value_no_null(idx, 1, false);
2000 }
2001 else
2002 inc_no_null(idx);
2003
2004 if (bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect())
2005 bv_null->set_bit_no_check(idx);
2006}
2007
2008//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2009
2010template<class Val, class BV>
2011void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::inc_no_null(size_type idx)
2012{
2013 if constexpr (parent_type::is_signed())
2014 {
2015 value_type v = get(idx);
2016 if (std::numeric_limits<value_type>::max() == v)
2017 v = 0;
2018 else
2019 ++v;
2020 set_value_no_null(idx, v, true);
2021 }
2022 else
2023 for (unsigned i = 0; i < parent_type::sv_value_slices; ++i)
2024 {
2025 bvector_type* bv = this->get_create_slice(i);
2026 if (bool carry_over = bv->inc(idx); !carry_over)
2027 break;
2028 } // for i
2029}
2030
2031//------------------------------------ ---------------------------------
2032
2033template<class Val, class BV>
2034void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::inc_no_null(size_type idx, value_type v)
2035{
2036 value_type v_prev = get(idx);
2037 set_value_no_null(idx, v + v_prev, true);
2038}
2039
2040//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2041
2042template<class Val, class BV>
2043void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::clear_all(bool free_mem) BMNOEXCEPT
2044{
2045 parent_type::clear_all(free_mem);
2046}
2047
2048//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2049
2050template<class Val, class BV>
2051bool sparse_vector<Val, BV>::find_rank(size_type rank, size_type& pos) BMNOEXCEPT
2052{
2053 BM_ASSERT(rank);
2054 pos = rank - 1;
2055 return true;
2056}
2057
2058//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2059
2060template<class Val, class BV>
2061sparse_vector<Val, BV>&
2062sparse_vector<Val, BV>::clear_range(
2063 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type left,
2064 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type right,
2065 bool set_null)
2066{
2067 parent_type::clear_range(left, right, set_null);
2068 return *this;
2069}

2071//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2072
2073template<class Val, class BV>
2074void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::calc_stat(
2075 struct sparse_vector<Val, BV>::statistics* st) const BMNOEXCEPT
2076{
2077 BM_ASSERT(st);
2078 typename bvector_type::statistics stbv;
2079 parent_type::calc_stat(&stbv);
2080 if (st)
2081 {
2082 st->reset();
2083 st->add(stbv);
2084 }
2085}
2086
2087//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2088
2089template<class Val, class BV>
2090void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::optimize(
2091 bm::word_t* temp_block,
2092 typename bvector_type::optmode opt_mode,
2093 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::statistics* st)
2094{
2095 typename bvector_type::statistics stbv;
2096 stbv.reset();
2097 parent_type::optimize(temp_block, opt_mode, st ? &stbv : 0);
2098
2099 if (st)
2100 {
2101 st->reset();
2102 st->add(stbv);
2103 }
2104}
2105
2106//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2107
2108template<class Val, class BV>
2109void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::optimize_gap_size()
2110{
2111 unsigned stored_slices = this->stored_slices();
2112 for (unsigned j = 0; j < stored_slices; ++j)
2113 {
2114 if (bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(j))
2115 bv->optimize_gap_size();
2116 }
2117}
2118
2119//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2120
2121template<class Val, class BV>
2122sparse_vector<Val, BV>&
2123sparse_vector<Val, BV>::join(const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv)
2124{
2125 size_type arg_size = sv.size();
2126 if (this->size_ < arg_size)
2127 resize(arg_size);
2128
2129 unsigned planes = (unsigned)this->bmatr_.rows();
2130 if (planes > sv.get_bmatrix().rows())
2131 --planes;
2132
2133 for (unsigned j = 0; j < planes; ++j)
2134 {
2135 if (const bvector_type* arg_bv = sv.bmatr_.row(j))
2136 {
2137 bvector_type* bv = this->get_create_slice(j);
2138 *bv |= *arg_bv;
2139 }
2140 } // for j
2141
2142 join_null_slice(sv);
2143 return *this;
2144}
2145
2146//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2147
2148template<class Val, class BV>
2149sparse_vector<Val, BV>&
2150sparse_vector<Val, BV>::merge(sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv)
2151{
2152 size_type arg_size = sv.size();
2153 if (this->size_ < arg_size)
2154 resize(arg_size);
2155
2156 this->merge_matr(sv.bmatr_);
2157
2158 join_null_slice(sv);
2159
2160 return *this;
2161}
2162
2163//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2164
2165template<class Val, class BV>
2166void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::join_null_slice(const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv)
2167{
2168 bvector_type* bv_null = this->get_null_bvect();
2169 size_type arg_size = sv.size();
2170
2171 // our vector is NULL-able but argument is not (assumed all values are real)
2172 if (bv_null)
2173 {
2174 if (!sv.is_nullable())
2175 bv_null->set_range(0, arg_size-1);
2176 }
2177 else // not NULL
2178 {
2179 if (sv.is_nullable())
2180 {
2181 this->bmatr_.set_null_idx(sv.bmatr_.get_null_idx());
2182 BM_ASSERT(this->get_null_bvect());
2183 }
2184 }
2185}
2186
2187
2188
2189template<class Val, class BV>
2190void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::copy_range(
2191 const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv,
2192 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type left,
2193 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type right,
2194 bm::null_support slice_null)
2195{
2196 if (left > right)
2197 bm::xor_swap(left, right);
2198 this->copy_range_slices(sv, left, right, slice_null);
2199 this->resize(sv.size());
2200}
2201
2202//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2203
2204template<class Val, class BV>
2205void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::keep_range(size_type left, size_type right,
2206 bm::null_support slice_null)
2207{
2208 if (right < left)
2209 bm::xor_swap(left, right);
2210 this->keep_range_no_check(left, right, slice_null);
2211}
2212
2213
2214//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2215
2216template<class Val, class BV>
2217void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::filter(
2218 const typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::bvector_type& bv_mask)
2219{
2220 unsigned slices = (unsigned)this->get_bmatrix().rows();
2221 for (unsigned j = 0; j < slices/*planes*/; ++j)
2222 {
2223 if (bvector_type* bv = this->bmatr_.get_row(j))
2224 bv->bit_and(bv_mask);
2225 } // for j
2226}
2227
2228//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2229
2230template<class Val, class BV>
2231int sparse_vector<Val, BV>::compare(size_type idx,
2232 const value_type val) const BMNOEXCEPT
2233{
2234 // TODO: consider bit-by-bit comparison to minimize CPU hit miss in plans get()
2235 value_type sv_value = get(idx);
2236 return (sv_value > val) - (sv_value < val);
2237}
2238
2239//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2240
2241template<class Val, class BV>
2242bool sparse_vector<Val, BV>::equal(const sparse_vector<Val, BV>& sv,
2243 bm::null_support null_able) const BMNOEXCEPT
2244{
2245 return parent_type::equal(sv, null_able);
2246}

2252sparse_vector<Val, BV>::begin() const BMNOEXCEPT
2253{
2254 typedef typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator it_type;
2255 return it_type(this);
2256}

2264 this->bmatr_.set_allocator_pool(pool_ptr);
2265}

2290 const typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::sparse_vector_type* sv
2291 ) BMNOEXCEPT

2300template<class Val, class BV>
2301sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::const_iterator(
2302 const typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::sparse_vector_type* sv,
2303 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT

2310//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2311
2312template<class Val, class BV>
2313void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::go_to(size_type pos) BMNOEXCEPT
2314{
2315 pos_ = (!sv_ || pos >= sv_->size()) ? bm::id_max : pos;
2316 buf_ptr_ = 0;
2317}
2318
2319//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2320
2321template<class Val, class BV>
2322bool sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::advance() BMNOEXCEPT
2323{
2324 if (pos_ == bm::id_max) // nothing to do, we are at the end
2325 return false;
2326 ++pos_;
2327 if (pos_ >= sv_->size())
2328 {
2329 this->invalidate();
2330 return false;
2331 }
2332 if (buf_ptr_)
2333 {
2334 ++buf_ptr_;
2335 if (buf_ptr_ - ((value_type*)buffer_.data()) >= n_buf_size)
2336 buf_ptr_ = 0;
2337 }
2338 return true;
2339}
2340
2341//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2342
2343template<class Val, class BV>
2344typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::value_type
2345sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::value() const
2346{
2347 BM_ASSERT(this->valid());
2348 value_type v;
2349
2350 if (!buf_ptr_)
2351 {
2352 buffer_.reserve(n_buf_size * sizeof(value_type));
2353 buf_ptr_ = (value_type*)(buffer_.data());
2354 sv_->extract(buf_ptr_, n_buf_size, pos_, true);
2355 }
2356 v = *buf_ptr_;
2357 return v;
2358}
2359
2360//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2361
2362template<class Val, class BV>
2363void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::skip_zero_values() BMNOEXCEPT
2364{
2365 value_type v = value();
2366 if (buf_ptr_)
2367 {
2368 v = *buf_ptr_;
2369 value_type* buf_end = ((value_type*)buffer_.data()) + n_buf_size;
2370 while(!v)
2371 {
2372 ++pos_;
2373 if (++buf_ptr_ < buf_end)
2374 v = *buf_ptr_;
2375 else
2376 break;
2377 }
2378 if (pos_ >= sv_->size())
2379 {
2380 pos_ = bm::id_max;
2381 return;
2382 }
2383 if (buf_ptr_ >= buf_end)
2384 buf_ptr_ = 0;
2385 }
2386}
2387
2388//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2389
2390template<class Val, class BV>
2391bool sparse_vector<Val, BV>::const_iterator::is_null() const BMNOEXCEPT
2392{
2393 return sv_->is_null(pos_);
2394}
2395
2396
2397//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2398//
2399//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2400
2401
2402template<class Val, class BV>
2403sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::back_insert_iterator()
2404: sv_(0), bv_null_(0), buf_ptr_(0), set_not_null_(true)
2405{}
2406
2407//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2408
2409template<class Val, class BV>
2410sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::back_insert_iterator(
2411 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::sparse_vector_type* sv)
2412: sv_(sv), set_not_null_(true)
2413{
2414 if (sv)
2415 {
2416 bv_null_ = sv_->get_null_bvect();
2417 buffer_.reserve(n_buf_size * sizeof(value_type));
2418 buf_ptr_ = (unsigned_value_type*)(buffer_.data());
2419 }
2420 else
2421 {
2422 buf_ptr_ = 0; bv_null_ = 0;
2423 }
2424}
2425
2426//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2427
2428template<class Val, class BV>
2429sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::back_insert_iterator(
2430 const typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator& bi)
2431: sv_(bi.sv_), bv_null_(bi.bv_null_), buf_ptr_(0),
2432 set_not_null_(bi.set_not_null_)
2433{
2434 if (sv_)
2435 {
2436 buffer_.reserve(n_buf_size * sizeof(value_type));
2437 buf_ptr_ = (unsigned_value_type*)(buffer_.data());
2438 }
2439}
2440
2441//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2442
2443template<class Val, class BV>
2444sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::back_insert_iterator(
2445 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator&& bi) BMNOEXCEPT
2446: sv_(bi.sv_), bv_null_(bi.bv_null_), buf_ptr_(bi.buf_ptr_),
2447 set_not_null_(bi.set_not_null_)
2448{
2449 buffer_.swap(bi.buffer_);
2450 buf_ptr_ = bi.buf_ptr_;
2451}
2452
2453//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2454
2455template<class Val, class BV>
2456sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::~back_insert_iterator()
2457{
2458 this->flush();
2459}
2460
2461//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2462
2463template<class Val, class BV>
2464void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::add(
2465 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::value_type v)
2466{
2467 BM_ASSERT(sv_);
2468 BM_ASSERT(buf_ptr_ && buffer_.data());
2469
2470 const unsigned_value_type* data_ptr = (const unsigned_value_type*)buffer_.data();
2471 size_type buf_idx = size_type(buf_ptr_ - data_ptr);
2472 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::size_type sz = sv_->size();
2473
2474 this->add_value_no_null(v);
2475
2476 if (bv_null_)
2477 {
2478 bv_null_->set_bit_no_check(sz + buf_idx);
2479 }
2480}
2481
2482//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2483
2484template<class Val, class BV>
2485BMFORCEINLINE
2486void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::add_value_no_null(
2487 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::value_type v)
2488{
2489 BM_ASSERT(sv_);
2490 BM_ASSERT(buf_ptr_ && buffer_.data());
2491
2492 sparse_vector<Val, BV>::unsigned_value_type uv =
2493 sparse_vector<Val, BV>::parent_type::s2u(v);
2494 size_type buf_idx = size_type(buf_ptr_ - (const unsigned_value_type*)buffer_.data());
2495 if (buf_idx >= n_buf_size)
2496 {
2497 this->flush();
2498 buf_ptr_ = (unsigned_value_type*)(buffer_.data());
2499 }
2500 *buf_ptr_++ = uv;
2501}
2502
2503//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2504
2505template<class Val, class BV>
2506void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::add_null()
2507{
2508 BM_ASSERT(bv_null_);
2509 this->add_value_no_null(value_type(0));
2510}
2511
2512//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2513
2514template<class Val, class BV>
2515void sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::add_null(
2516 typename sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::size_type count)
2517{
2518 if (count < 32)
2519 {
2520 for (size_type i = 0; i < count; ++i)
2521 this->add_value_no_null(value_type(0));
2522 }
2523 else
2524 {
2525 this->flush();
2526 sv_->push_back_null(count);
2527 }
2528}
2529
2530//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2531
2532template<class Val, class BV>
2533bool sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::empty() const
2534{
2535 return (!sv_ || (buf_ptr_ == (unsigned_value_type*)buffer_.data()));
2536}
2537
2538//---------------------------------------------------------------------
2539
2540template<class Val, class BV>
2541bool sparse_vector<Val, BV>::back_insert_iterator::flush()
2542{
2543 if (!sv_)
2544 return false;
2545 unsigned_value_type* arr = (unsigned_value_type*)buffer_.data();
2546 size_type arr_size = size_type(buf_ptr_ - arr);
2547 if (!arr_size)
2548 return false;
2549 sv_->import_back_u(arr, arr_size, false);
2550 buf_ptr_ = (unsigned_value_type*) buffer_.data();
2551 return true;
2552}
2553
2554//---------------------------------------------------------------------

2557} // namespace bm
